body: Well whatever is local to the given os
Sorry, are you asking a question?

Just trying to help you.

Explicitly adding the separator without checking usually doesn't introduce problems (I know that Ubuntu Linux and Window$ 7 will consider §//§ and §\§ same as single of it (Linux uses §\§ as escaper§). Also, I know that Window$ understands paths regardless of §/§ or §\§, but there are spots where it doesn't) but allows to work around the separator not being there by default. It doesn't need much code to check for it, though, before passing the path on.

Yeah, I know, `filepath.Separator` returns the OS local separator.
Pull requests always welcome.

The issue is here in order for it not to be forgotten.

Hi. I am new to Syncthing and I would like to start contributing. It seems that this issue is a good one to start with, so I would like to do it, but could you please tell me where have you spotted this problem?

We should ideally do it somewhere here in folder validation as we load the config:
https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/blob/master/internal/config/config.go#L259

As invalid configuration could be inserted into the xml file later causing errors.

issue.title: Ensuring path separator at the end of the folder path. (fixes #1262)
